Hedera Reveals Mainnet Exploit Led To Loss Of Liquidity Pools Tokens
entry.summary:
In a Twitter announcement, Hedera confirmed an exploit in its mainnet, leading to a loss of liquidity tokens. However, the firm noted the exploit did not impact its consensus layer.
Network exploitation is among the challenges of many crypto projects, with DeFi protocols recording the highest hack incidents since 2021. The latest exploit is that of Hedera, a decentralized, open-source, proof-of-stake public ledger.
Hedera Discloses Details of Mainnet Exploit
Hadera is the firm behind distributed ledger Hedera Hashgraph. In the latest hack, the attackers exploited the Smart Contract service code of its mainnet and transferred service tokens from user accounts to their accounts.
The hackers targeted liquidity pool accounts on multiple decentralized exchanges (DEXs) that use Uniswap‚Ä¶

entry.title: Banking Sector In Crisis: Silicon Valley Bank Closed By Regulator
entry.summary:
Another bank is in crisis; Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) has followed the financial freefall amid Federal Reserve (Fed) Chairman Jerome Powell‚Äôs hawkish macroeconomic view and tightening policies to control inflation rates.¬†
With over 40 years in the market, Silicon Valley Bank is facing a significant downturn in its shares, falling more than 60% since Thursday.¬†
On Wednesday, the go-to bank for venture capitalists and tech startups launched a massive $1.75 billion securities sale to raise capital and try to recoup its earlier losses, raising concerns among investors. According to several reports, the financial institution was closed by Californian regulators.¬†

entry.title: Biden Budget Proposal Targets Crypto Investors Using Like-Kind Exchange Provision; Plan Aims to Tax Crypto Miners 30%
entry.summary:
On Thursday, the Biden administration released the U.S. president‚Äôs 182-page budget proposal for the fiscal year 2024, which aims to ‚Äúgrow the economy from the bottom up and middle out.‚Äù The budget includes an $835 billion increase in military spending, but the administration claims it will reduce the deficit by $3 trillion over the next decade. Additionally, the budget proposes ‚Äúclosing a loophole that benefits wealthy crypto investors‚Äù and plans to gradually introduce a 30% tax on the electricity used in cryptocurrency mining.
Biden Budget Aims to Reduce Deficit by Raising Taxes

entry.title: Biggest Movers: DOGE Down 10%, Falling to Lowest Point Since October
entry.summary:
Dogecoin fell to its lowest level since October, as cryptocurrency prices plunged during Friday‚Äôs session. Overall, the global crypto market cap dropped by nearly 9% today, which seems to have been triggered by yesterday‚Äôs liquidation of Silvergate bank. Litecoin has been another notable mover, falling by over 17%.
Dogecoin (DOGE)
Dogecoin fell to a five-month low on Friday, as crypto prices continued to plummet, following the liquidation of Silvergate Bank.
DOGE/USD dropped to an intraday low of $0.06302 earlier in the day, less than 24 hours after trading at a high of $0.0722.
As a result of the decline, dogecoin fell to its lowest point since October 26, when price bottomed out at $0.0627.
Looking at the chart, the sell-off came as the relative strength index (RSI) of 14 days dropped below a long-term floor at 30.00
As of writing, the index is tracking at 21.52, which is very deep in bearish territory, and its weakest reading since July 12.
This latest slippage in price could tempt longer-term bulls to buy the current dip, however an instant rebound may not be on the cards.
Litecoin (LTC)
Litecoin (LTC) also dropped to a multi-month low in today‚Äôs session, as the token fell by as much as 17%.
Following a high of $84.76 on Thursday, LTC/USD slid to a low of $69.14 earlier in Friday‚Äôs session.
This plunge saw litecoin fall to its weakest level since New Year‚Äôs Eve, when the token dropped to a bottom at $67.57.
Overall, LTC has now traded in the red for a fifth consecutive session, and is down nearly 23% in the past week.
Like with dogecoin, the collapse in price has sent the 14-day RSI to an eight-month low, as it is currently tracking at 23.75.
A floor at $63.00 could be a target for sellers, in the event that current sentiment extends into the weekend.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect a reversal in prices in the coming days? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Cryptocurrency Insurance: The Pros and Cons of Protecting Your Assets
entry.summary:
Cryptocurrencies have transformed the financial world by enabling decentralized and secure transactions. However, as the popularity of cryptocurrencies grows, so does the demand for cryptocurrency insurance. In this article, we will look at the benefits and drawbacks of insuring your cryptocurrency assets.

What is the definition of cryptocurrency insurance?

Cryptocurrency insurance protects investors against the loss of their cryptocurrency assets due to theft, hacking, or other forms of cybercrime.

It offers protection to both individuals and businesses who own significant amounts of cryptocurrencies and want to protect their assets from potential risks.

The Benefits of Cryptocurrency Insurance

Anti-Hacking and Cybercrime Protectio‚Ä¶

entry.summary: Decrypt launches a real-time feed of human and AI-generated breaking news summaries from around the web.

entry.title: Judges Scrutinize SEC Over Denial of Grayscale Bitcoin ETF
entry.summary: The company‚Äôs lawsuit against the SEC reached a pivotal moment as judges questioned the agency‚Äôs decision-making.

entry.title: Esports Giant TSM Forges Ahead With Web3 Gaming on Avalanche
entry.summary: Team SoloMid will host tournaments on Blitz Esports‚Äô Avalanche Subnet.

entry.title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell: Crypto 'Turmoil, Fraud, Run Risk' Is Being Monitored
entry.summary: The Federal Reserve Chairman said that innovation shouldn‚Äôt be stifled but financial institutions need to take "great care" in how they interact with crypto.

entry.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.

entry.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'
entry.summary: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.

entry.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'
entry.summary: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term ‚Äúmetaverse‚Äù in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel ‚ÄúSnow Crash.‚Äù Now he‚Äôs helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in ‚ÄúSnow Crash,‚Äù goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver
entry.summary: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.

entry.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'
entry.summary: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast
entry.summary: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.

entry.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace
entry.summary: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."

entry.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini
entry.summary: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."

entry.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'
entry.summary: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.

entry.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria
entry.summary: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."

entry.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next
entry.summary: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next‚Äîincluding token-gated sneaker drops.

entry.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs
entry.summary: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.

entry.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'
entry.summary: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."
